events.comment: Clicking on anything but menus with cursor = 1(walk) will walk within the walkable area.
the player destination is the mouse click position.
A new destination it's assign if click outside the edges or walkable area (this sprobably it's gonna change in each room)
If walking, will assign the correct walk animation based on the direction of movement. ←→↑↓
Idling left or right based on it's last direction
Once the player finished the use animation and it's not interacting with anything else

Return Button

Select Button
If click on an inventory slot
when look at inventory slots, narration should say description. Make sure to add exceptions (lists and map)

events.name: Collect items and add to inventory

events.comment: Check if need to add an item
Look for a slot that already display the same item as picked
in case a slot is found, add item to inventory
if number of items > 1 change the animation
reset InventoryItemHandle variable

In case, there is no slot with the same item displayed as picked, look for a free slot
In case free slot is found, pass the item name to the slot and set the animaton of the slot to display the item
add item to inventory
reset InventoryItemHandle variable

"¡Para Pedro - Número uno - el mejor aventurero del mundo!"

"La manzana es útil si tienes hambre"
"Las gafas están un poco sucias, pero no están dañadas. Alguien probablemente necesita esto."

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: When masked, the masked object is only visible through the mask.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteMasking
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use a sprite or a shape painter to mask another object.

eventsFunctions.description: Define a shape painter as a mask of an object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Mask an object with a shape painter
eventsFunctions.name: MaskWithShapePainter

parameters.description: Shape painter to use as a mask
parameters.name: Mask

eventsFunctions.description: Define a sprite as a mask of an object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Mask an object with a sprite
eventsFunctions.name: Mask

parameters.description: Sprite object to use as a mask
parameters.name: Mask

eventsFunctions.description: Remove the mask of the specified object.
eventsFunctions.name: Unmask

parameters.description: Object with a mask to remove
parameters.name: Masked

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension can be used to create multiple copies of an object in a wide variety of arrangements, including:
- horizontal row(s)
- vertical column(s)
- a solid rectangle or square
- an evenly spaced grid
- a grid with different spacing between rows and columns

After the objects are created, you can reference their object variables to manage the objects:

* `RowID`:  what horizontal row does this object reside in,
* `ColumnID`:  what vertical column does this object reside in,
* `CreationID`:  starting top-left, and proceeding from left to right, what is the number of the created object,
* `BatchID`:  optional identifier assigned to all objects created

Watch this [tutorial video](https://youtu.be/rlGSlNSRR9w) to see examples of how to use this extension.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.

eventsFunctions.description:
Create multiple copies of an object.
Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create _PARAM2_ rows and _PARAM3_ columns of _PARAM1_ objects, with top-left starting position _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_, with _PARAM6_px between rows and _PARAM7_px between columns. Create objects on _PARAM9_ with a Z-value of _PARAM10_. Assign all objects the BatchID of _PARAM8_.

events.comment: Temp object is created to record its width and height (which is needed to calculate spacing).
Temp variables to track progress in drawing the grid
Starting at top left, create objects in grid.
If the current row is complete, move to the next row.
If the last row is complete, stop creating new objects.

parameters.description: (Optional) Identifier assigned to all objects created in this batch
parameters.name: BatchID

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Prevents the back button from quitting the game and provides a condition to check when it's pressed (to allow customising its behavior).
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BackButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds interactions with the back button

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers whenever the player presses the back button
eventsFunctions.name: onBackButtonPressed

eventsFunctions.description:
This simulates the normal action of the back button. 
This action will quit the app when in a mobile app, and go back to the previous page when in a web browser.
eventsFunctions.name: doDefault

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Add00
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Display emoji characters in text objects and store them in strings. Emojis will look different deppending on the platform/device due do default font faces.

This extension provide:
- An string expression for get the emoji by name
- An string expression for get the emoji by hexadecimal code

See the description of these expressions for get the list available emoji.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Emojis
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Display emoji characters in text objects and store them in strings.

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the specified emoji, from the provided name.
eventsFunctions.name: Name

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the specified emoji, from a hexadecimal value
eventsFunctions.name: Hex

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Lim98SE
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension provide two behaviors:

- Turn object into cursor
Make the object as the new cursor

- Clickable button 
Provide a new condition on the object for fast checking is this one has been clicked.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MouseHelper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_mouse_wireless.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Check if a sprite has been clicked and turn any objects into a cursor.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: An easy way to turn any object into a mouse cursor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: cursor

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Turns any object into a button, useful to know if it has been clicked with a simple object condition.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: button

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: isClicked

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: VegeTato, arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Convenience conditions, actions and behaviors for timers to trigger a condition every X seconds.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RepeatEveryXSeconds
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This allows to trigger an event every X seconds.

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds X amount of times.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Repeat every X seconds in X number
eventsFunctions.name: RepeatXTimes

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

parameters.longDescription: The condition will trigger at most this amount of times. Make it -1 for looping forever.
parameters.name: limit

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows to repeat an object timer every X seconds.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RepeatTimer

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds, where X is defined in the behavior properties.
eventsFunctions.name: Repeat

eventsFunctions.description: Allows to trigger the recurring timer X times again.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetLimit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Allow to trigger the recurring timer _PARAM1_ of _PARAM0_ X times again

propertyDescriptors.label: The name of the timer to repeat
propertyDescriptors.name: TimerName

propertyDescriptors.label: The time between each trigger (in seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: TimerLength

propertyDescriptors.label: How many times should the timer trigger? -1 for forever.
propertyDescriptors.name: Limit

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allow you to check for double-clicks with the left, middle, or right button of a mouse. It will also allow you to detect double-taps on touchscreens. 

Please note: Touch devices do not have alternatives for middle/right clicks. Taps on a touch device will get counted for _any_ use of these conditions, so you should either design your controls accordingly, or build out separate events if the device has a touch screen.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DoubleClick
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_mouse_wireless_pc.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Check for a double-click with a mouse, or a double-tap on a touchscreen.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified mouse button is clicked twice in a short amount of time.
eventsFunctions.name: HasDoubleClicked
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ mouse button is double-clicked (or double-tap on a touchscreen)

parameters.longDescription: As touch devices do not have middle/right tap equivalents, you will need to account for this within your events if you're not using the left mouse button and building for touch devices.
parameters.name: MouseButton

eventsFunctions.description: Set the maximum delay between two clicks (or two taps) to be considered as a double click
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxDelay
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the double-click maximum delay between two clicks (or two taps) to _PARAM1_s

parameters.longDescription: By default, this value is 0.5 seconds.
parameters.name: MaxDelay

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Gustavo Marciano
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Set the depth (Z-order) of the instance to the value of its Y position in the scene, creating an illusion of depth. The origin point of the object is used to determine the Z-order.

Useful for isometric games, 2D games with a "Top-Down" view, RPG...
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: YSort
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create an illusion of depth by setting the Z-order based on the Y position of the object. Useful for isometric games, 2D games with a "Top-Down" view, RPG...

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Set the depth (Z-order) of the instance to the value of its Y position in the scene, creating an illusion of depth. The origin point of the object is used to determine the Z-order.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: YSort

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Provides two conditions:
* The cursor is moving
* The cursor has stayed still for a given duration
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_mouse_pc.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Conditions checking the cursor movement (is it moving, is it still since a specified duration...)

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor has stayed still for the specified time.
eventsFunctions.name: CursorStayStill
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cursor has stayed still for _PARAM1_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is moving.
eventsFunctions.name: CursorIsMoving
